header.title: JIRA XML ➜ JSONL (Agent-ready)
header.subtitle: Converts Jira RSS XML exports into JSONL (1 issue per line), cleaned for search (RAG/embeddings).
header.tip: Tip: you can paste paths with quotes or drag & drop them into the terminal.
step.input.title: 1) Input folder (where your XMLs are)
step.input.howto: Paste the folder path. It can be relative (./exports) or absolute.
step.output.title: 2) Output file (JSONL)
step.output.howto:
Enter path + filename.
- If you type 'agent_ready.jsonl' → creates with extension.
- If you type only 'agent_ready' → creates with NO extension (no forcing).
Tip: you can include a folder too (e.g. ./out/agent_ready.jsonl).
step.recursive.title: 3) Search subfolders too?
step.recursive.howto: Enable this if you have XMLs in nested folders.
step.sort.title: 4) Sort files by name before processing?
step.sort.howto: Helps keep output stable and reproducible.
step.customfields.title: 5) Include customfields in JSON?
step.customfields.howto: Recommended for search. May increase file size.
step.rawxml.title: 6) Include raw_item_xml (raw <item> XML)?
step.rawxml.howto: Only if you want full lossless data. Can get large.
step.beautify.title: 7) Beautify?
step.beautify.howto: Also generates a .pretty.json (indented) for reading/debug. JSONL remains 1 line per issue.
step.failfast.title: 8) Stop on first error?
step.failfast.howto: If disabled, it skips problematic files and continues.
ui.no_xml: No *.xml found in this folder (or subfolders).
ui.must_dir: ⚠️  Must be a valid folder. Try again.
